column5: Hey... that looks like my truck! HH
gotta love canada.  the country of the strong and free, especially if you're a criminal.
What we need here:  http://www.thestar.com/news/world/article/1217785--republican-vigilantes-target-accused-drug-dealers-in-northern-ireland?bn=1
You mean the IBM lot at Vic Park and Steels? Yikes I'm 3 blocks south on Sparks, but I think I'm Ok, right next to the Police Credit Union!
not that one, the software place by 407 and Warden.   Hey HH, as tempting as your offer sounds I'll stick with what I have...

Don't get me started....its rediculously frustrating as hell...I get them to court, court hugs them tussles their hair an pats them on the bum. The problem is the court system, not the law enforcement

My truck was robbed last night!  They got a $1.20 a new serpentine belt, new coolant temp censor and new fuel filter so if he has a 88 chevy c1500 I hope shes running good now....  :thumbsup_anim:    I forgive you...
I parked my truck in a lot last year in Niagra falls---came back and there was paw prints on it like you describe  don't these guys wash their front feet?

Getting the goofs on cam wont do anything.  When I lived in a condo in Mississauga I had my truck stolen twice (in 6 months)from my underground parking spot which was right by the enterance to the elevators.  They caught the guys in clear view of several cameras.  The cops told me that its unlikely that they will catch the guys, in the grand scheme of things car theft is low on their priority list.  My insurance company even told me that they can potentially consider that I live in a high crime area (Clarkson/Oakville boarder).  From what you are saying, it seems that the guys knew to go under the hood to disable the car alarm first (not their time breaking into cars)...  I hate to say it but there is little that you could have done to prevent it.  What you could do though is to really get to know your neighbours... If the guys know that there are potential eyes they would avoid your street.  Many years ago the same thing happened on my parent's street.  Some kids (5-8 guys in their late teens/early 20's)decided to break into cars on people driveways (I think they broke into 20-25 cars) well one of them ended breaking a car window to get some change that was left in a car, well they ended up waking up the homeowner, who ended making a ton of noise chasing the dudes.  Long story short, someone ended up IDing one of the guys, and they got nabbed, not sure about his partners.   Since then no cars have been broken into.
Don't keep anything in your vehicle worth stealing and you'll be fine..
Ha! not a Good idea, I had nothing of value and assume thats why it was burt...now I leave the doors open and 5bucks in the cup holder, they can take the money and go on there way.
X2

ive been the victim of auto theft over a dozen times - both whole vehicle or break in. police in our area do not respond to car theft of any kind. you need to make a police report for your insurance company you go to the police station and get in line for one.  had an officer tell me once that auto theft in hamilton (6000 vehicles a year BTW) was a 'victimless crime' as the insurance company covers your losses anyway...took my breath away!!  so the idea that local enforcement is gonna send out the CSI team to satisfy you over some dusty handprints is laughable.
WOW !!!! ...I'd definetly be looking for a different place to live.  In all my years of owning a car, I can honestly say I have NEVER had a break-in.  Just real lucky I spose

Hamilton is the car theft capital of Ontario.  I have a buddy that lives in Brampton and his vehicle was constantly getting broken into.  Now he just leaves the doors unlocked and nothing of value in it.  About 2 or 3 times a month he notices that his glove box has been rummaged through or the interior light is on. He just shrugs his shoulders and goes to work.  I could never live like that.  It is a sad state of affairs.

Rampant here lew - sometimes the whole car, a window here, a rummaging there, stereo a couple times, sometimes just a look thru..  The worst ones are when they do a significant amount of damge but DON'T TAKE THE DAMN THING!!!  I can honestly say I don't know anyone that hasn't had their car stolen or broken into in this area.  Its usually the nicer neighborhoods and shopping areas that are targeted..remember there is "hamilton" and then the surrounding towns that amalgamated..this is where most of the cars get yanked.

I'm looking for anyone who can help on this one.  I go to take off from work today to go home and my car looks like it's been man handeled by someone covered in dust.  I check a few other cars around and they all have the same hand prints on them.  My car they tried to get in from the driverside door and even pop the hood.  I had to get going home for my son's soccer do I didn't call the police.  Is there anything I can do?  There are very visable finger prints on my hood and doors.  At first I thought it could have been a joke but no way would a joke like 'that' have been done to 15 or more car's.  ideads, help?  thanks!  G
If they didn't actually get in, no crime has been committed.  Cops won't do a thing.
even when I counted 15 car's all marked up?  I never went to check on the other car's to see if the doors were open and if things were missing as I don't know the owner of each car...
Could have been a bunch of stupid kids looking in the window.  You can call, I just wouldn't expect much if nothing's actually been taken/broken/damaged.
Cover your car with toxic secretions from the poison dart frog, same as the Amerindians' indigenous use it to poison the tips of blowdart.
I'd consider yourself lucky,maybe take turns at work taking a peak out,just to see if you can catch someone.
I'm not expecting much at all but just wondering.  after all, there have been break in's in cars in the last month and or damage.  it's a hard to see spot and it's loaded with cars.
I'm going to start parking by you then.  the walks about the same I guess...
Set up a game camera and catch the buggers in the act.
If I had one you can bet your   I would be using it!

I'd call it in anyway. If there is a problem and enough others in the area do the same perhaps a patrol car might just do a check of the area and catch them in the act.  They can't act on something if they know nothing about it.
Not sure a "crime" was committed here Geoff...I suppose it can be reported, but I wouldn't expect much to come of it.  Are there surveillance cameras in the lot where you work?
Could it of been "someone" dusting for prints? lol

In KW even if they had broken in and stolen everything in the car the police will not send someone out... Had that happen a few years ago. The police there will just ask for an inventory of what was stolen, and will write you a police report for insurance....
Yup, IBM parking lot is loaded with them BUT last time a window was smashed they wouldn't share the info as we don't work for IBM.  It was a too bad so sad for you type of reply...
and no, it wasn't prints like this...
or crazy glue live hornets to the handles of the doors.
if there was no damage to your car and nothing stolen there isnt' much that can be done. you can try to file a report but no suspects, no witnesses, no victims, it'll get closed as unfounded.
i havent had stuff like that since the 70s....send some this way you two
Are there any bell towers in the area? Y'all can hang out up there with a Sharps rifle and wait.
that's what I was waiting for, thanks, case closed and this post can die a slow death...
still parking at the go lot?  maybe you can call them.  there might be cameras?
I had my truck broken into a few years back (over $4,000 worth of stuff was stolen)... cops didnt even bother to show up for that. Timmy's must have been quite busy that day.

That sucks bud... here's what I can do to help you... I'll trade you even up... your car for my truck... no one breaks into my truck... sure they may open it up, but after looking inside, they tend to leave stuff for me! You wouldn't think that a thief would have a heart, but most feel sorry for me! LMAO HH

Don't waste your time even if they break in, steal your stuff, and set it on fire the little punks will walk free....trust me I know.    Big problems with the Cops and Court systems....I i lay a finger on the lil crap I'll be in jail while they walk free
